meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for some serious nostalgia and a healthy dose of retro gaming goodness as I dive into the world of Octopath Traveler.

Now, before I start gushing about this fantastic game, let's get one thing out of the way: all these fancy critics giving it high scores? Yeah, I'm on board with that. But hey, being part of the cool kids' club isn't everything – what really matters is how this game makes me feel.

And boy, does Octopath Traveler deliver! The moment I booted up the game and saw those gorgeous, pixel-perfect characters and environments, I was transported back to my childhood, playing classic JRPGs like Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy VI. There's something undeniably charming about the game's aesthetic – it's like someone took all the best parts of old-school RPGs, threw in some modern flair, and voilà! Magic happens.

Of course, not everyone will be as smitten with Octopath Traveler's retro charm as I am. Some folks might find the storytelling a bit wonky, what with the eight different character arcs that, while interesting individually, don't necessarily mesh together like butter on toast. But hey, who needs cohesive storytelling when you have combat systems as sweet as this? Trust me, I'm not complaining – I'm just enjoying the ride.

Now, let's get real for a second: Octopath Traveler isn't perfect. It has its quirks and imperfections, but that's part of what makes it so lovable. And hey, who doesn't love a good challenge? The game's battle system is no cakewalk – you'll need to think strategically and use your abilities wisely if you want to emerge victorious.

All in all, Octopath Traveler is the perfect blend of old-school nostalgia and modern flair. It's a game that will transport you back to a bygone era, but with enough fresh twists and turns to keep things exciting. So what are you waiting for? Join me on this fantastical journey through time – Hippo Penny out!
